label: Noms
Description1: Noms is a database for use in decentralized and distributed applications
Description2:
Noms is a database designed for use in decentralized and distributed applications.

Noms models data directly as a content-addressed directed acyclic graph -- the same basic data structure that blockchains, git, and other decentralized applications use. This makes it fit into decentralized applications especially well. For example, a Noms database can be used as the ledger component of a blockchain, or it can store the state of a rich peer-to-peer application.
description:
#The versioned, forkable, syncable database
##About Noms
![About Noms](https://www.youtube.com/embed/womWInzG-00)
 ###Noms is a database for use in decentralized and distributed applications
Noms is a database designed for use in decentralized and distributed applications.

Noms models data directly as a content-addressed directed acyclic graph -- the same basic data structure that blockchains, git, and other decentralized applications use. This makes it fit into decentralized applications especially well. For example, a Noms database can be used as the ledger component of a blockchain, or it can store the state of a rich peer-to-peer application.
